message: Missing django-bower as a pip install

Remove hard dependency on django-bower.

Updated README to instruct users to install django-bower if static
assets are not already handled.

Fixes #151

Remove deprecated setting CHECK_PERMISSION_FUNC.

Was deprecated in 2014.
Add support for extending specific classes

Add support for upcoming Django 2.0; drop support for Django < 1.11

Django 2.0 is scheduled to be released later this year. See:

https://code.djangoproject.com/wiki/Version2.0Roadmap

Can begin testing for compatibility and bugs now.

Django 2.0 is not backwards compatible with Django < 1.11, so support
was dropped. The backwards compatibility is documented:

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/internals/release-process/#deprecation-policy

Supports schedules documented:

https://www.djangoproject.com/download/#supported-versions

Update and improve project links

- Prefer https over http
- Drop unnecessary utm_* style "campaign" parameters to improve privacy
- Use updated dateutil documentation
- Drop comment with bogus URL to improve grep
- For the read the docs badge, use the documented URL, https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/badges.html
- Prefer readthedocs.io instead of readthedocs.org for doc links

Read the Docs moved hosting to readthedocs.io instead of readthedocs.org.

For additional details, see:

https://blog.readthedocs.com/securing-subdomains/

> Starting today, Read the Docs will start hosting projects from subdomains on
> the domain readthedocs.io, instead of on readthedocs.org. This change
> addresses some security concerns around site cookies while hosting user
> generated data on the same domain as our dashboard.

Remove the SCHEDULER_BASE_CLASSES feature

The feature is brittle with buggy edge cases. Use cases can be better
solved through other methods such as the EventRelation model. Reduce the
large maintenance burden by removing the feature. Results in cleaner
code that follows Django reusable app conventions.

Closes #357
Closes #310
Closes #306
Fix all spellings of occurence -> occurrence

Remove broken pypip.in badges

pypip.in is down. See the following for more details:

https://github.com/badges/pypipins/issues/39

Add tox.ini to allow testing the full test matrix locally

tox is a virtualenv management and test command line tool. It is a
powerful and commonly used tool for running tests across multiple
environments. This allows locally running the project's tests against
the full test matrix of supported Python and Django versions with a
single command.

For additional information on using tox, see:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/
remove code health badge and add pre-commit
